xcsf.classifier
Class Classifier

java.lang.Object
  xcsf.classifier.Classifier
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Cloneable
public class Classifier
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Cloneable

This class encapsulates methods for matching, prediction and classifier updates.

Author:
Patrick O. Stalph, Martin V. Butz

Classifier

public Classifier(StateDescriptor state,
                  int timestamp)
Default constructor used for covering.

See Also:
for the covering mechanism.

doesMatch

public boolean doesMatch(StateDescriptor state)
Returns if the ConditionHyperEllispoid matches the given state.

Parameters:
state - the state to match.
Returns:
true, if the condition matches the state.

predict

Generates the prediction for the given state.

Parameters:

Returns:
the prediction for the given state.

update1

public void update1(StateDescriptor state)
Updates the experience, prediction and predictionError of this classifier.

The update methods are seperated for performance reasons.

Parameters:
state - The current state, which this classifier matches.

update2

public void update2(double accuracy,
                    double accuracySum,
                    int numerositySum)
Updates the setSizeEstimate and the fitness.

Precondition: update1(StateDescriptor) was called before.

The update methods are seperated for performance reasons.

Parameters:
accuracy - the accuracy of this classifier.
accuracySum - the sum of accuracies in the MatchSet this classifier is in.
numerositySum - the sum of numerosities in the MatchSet this classifier is in.

clone

public Classifier clone()
Creates a clone of this classifier. Note, that the numerosity is reduced to one and the fitness is proportinal to the new numerosity. Additionally the gainmatrix of the RLSPrediction is reset.

Overrides:
clone in class java.lang.Object
Returns:
a clone of this classifier with numerosity one, fitness proportinal to the numerosity and a new prediction gainmatrix.
See Also:
Object.clone()

toString

public java.lang.String toString()
Overrides:
toString in class java.lang.Object
